name: 梁曉帆
objective: This course provides an overview of the basic concepts of decision theory and their applications on the real-world decision problems. Students will learn about the identification and modeling of decision problems, the modeling and estimation of uncertainties, and the modeling and evaluation of preferences.
schedule:
Module 1 Decision (W1~3, W6)
1: Introduction
2: Elements of decision problems
3: Structuring decisions
4: Making choices
5: Sensitivity analysis
6: Creativity and decision making
Module 2 Uncertainty (W7~8, W11-13, W9: mid-term exam)
1: Probability basics
2: Subjective probability
3: Theoretical probability models
4: Using data
5: Monte Carlo simulation
6: Value of Information
Module 3 Preference (W14~17, W18: final exam)
1: Risk attitudes
2: Utility axioms, paradoxes, and implications
3: Conflicting objectives I
4: Conflicting objectives II
scorePolicy:
Mid-term exam: 25%
Final exam: 25%
Homework and Participation: 50%
materials: Making hard decisions with DeccisionTools (2001) by Clemen and Reilly, Duxbury (雙葉)
